alert.note: Alert for Boone; Gallatin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:34AM EDT until June 17 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EDT FOR OHIO...CENTRAL SWITZERLAND...CENTRAL BOONE AND CENTRAL GALLATIN COUNTIES... At 1134 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Patriot, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Rising Sun, Warsaw, Florence, Glencoe, Fairview, Patriot, Center Square, Aberdeen, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Waterloo, Steele Bottom, Markland, Rabbit Hash, Quercus Grove, Mount Sterling, North Landing, Jacksonville, Egypt Bottom, US Route 42 at State Route 184 and Ethridge. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 62 and 63. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
